intro: Maesa brassii, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are surrounded by velvety, dark green bracts that resemble star shapes. Maesa brassii typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
